overview: This capstone subject brings Music Studies students together to plan, develop and present a creative plan and grant proposal. Through workshops, guided group sessions, and in-class discussions, students learn to work collaboratively by developing and refining their creative vision for a performing arts project.
The capstone experience culminates in a project plan, comprising an overview and strategy for practical implementation, and a grant proposal, which includes a financial plan and case for support.
ilo: propose and develop a concept for a performing arts project;
apply industry-standard management principles to a project plan and simulated grant proposal;
work collaboratively and constructively within a team to foster creativity and generate innovative solutions;
critically reflect and self-assess contributions to a group creative planning process.
generic_skills: communicate effectively, in oral, written and digital forms;
communicate constructively in different social situations;
work as part of a team to achieve a common goal;
manage competing demands on time, including self-directed project work;
sustain medium and long-term work strategies in pursuit of personal goals.

Inherent requirements (core participatio.content: Further details on how to seek academic adjustments can be found on the Student Equity and Disability Support website:http://services.unimelb.edu.au/student-equity/home

assessment.timing: Second half of the teaching period

assessment.brief: Project plan supported with a 200-word personal reflection

assessment.hurdle: Students must attend a minimum of 75% of all scheduled classes.

date_times.contact_hours: 24 hours, comprising one 2-hour class per week.
